meanings.definition: To force out of a proper vessel or channel
meanings.sent1: The water was extravasating from the cracked pipe.
meanings.sent2: The juice started extravasating from the squeezed orange.
meanings.sent3: The ketchup bottle seemed to be extravasating its contents all over the table.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a river, extravasating uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing cup was extravasating liquid all over the counter.

meanings.definition: To exude or pass out of a vessel into surrounding tissues
meanings.sent1: The blood was extravasating from the wound.
meanings.sent2: The perfume was extravasating a sweet scent into the room.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing bathtub was extravasating bubbles everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to extravasate into the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun was extravasating through the window onto the floor.
